definition: to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure
to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: The invention also discloses a producing method of above light leading board .
sentences.chinese: 本發明還揭露了一種製造上述導光板的方法。

sentences.english: Heidegger revealed the necessity for explicitly restating the question of Being.
sentences.chinese: 海德格的詮釋現象學揭露了重提存有問題的必要性。

sentences.english: The problem is that many violators remain, even after they are exposed .
sentences.chinese: 問題在於，很多違犯者即使被揭露了也還在那裏待着。

sentences.english: The revelation of his past lead to his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 對他過去的揭露導致了他的辭職。

sentences.english: He outed Tang Jun, former president of Microsoft China, for making false claims about his academic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他揭露了微軟中國前主席唐駿的學歷造假事情。

sentences.english: Burtynsky's photos reveal that, but aren't devoid of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 博廷斯基的照片揭露了這些，但並不缺乏美感。

sentences.english: The other exposes corruption surrounding Aids relief to villages in China.
sentences.chinese: 另一個揭露了中國農村艾滋病援助的腐敗。

sentences.english: Please keep in mind that the revelation process is a part of merging.
sentences.chinese: 請用心記住揭露過程是融合的一部分。

sentences.english: Find out how to make that connection with self-disclosure.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解如何通過自我揭露更進一步。

sentences.english: That is what I seek to discover in this movie.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我要在這部電影中尋求揭露的東西。

sentences.english: Hi, this is Jack and I'm here exposing esoteric cults and information-control.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，我是傑克，我在這裏揭露祕密教團和信息控制。

sentences.english: SaLuSa: I will not get the opportunity to meet you straight after Disclosure.
sentences.chinese: 大揭露之後我將不能得到機會直接與你見面。

sentences.english: The Sn, Pb, and Ag anomalies delineated with the technology have been identified by trenching.
sentences.chinese: 利用該技術圈定的異常，經探槽揭露證實爲礦化異常。

sentences.english: The chip exploited the fact that DNA exists naturally as a double-stranded molecule.
sentences.chinese: 芯片的試驗揭露了DNA雙螺旋分子結構的事實。

sentences.english: What you are doing is equivalent to getting angry at the tester for pointing out a fault in your system.
sentences.chinese: 你所做的只是遷怒於文章作者揭露了你體制上的缺點。

definition: to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
to make known to the masses (idiom); to publicize widely/to let the world know
the truth about sth/the actual facts
to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know
